review_title: Forget fundraising, you may as well be in sales.
pros:
Great cause, most people are really lovely.
The members are amazing people and it’s a real pleasure to get to meet them.
cons:
Where do I start?! The entire fundraising team lives in a culture of fear with two of the most volatile and cutthroat people I have ever had the misfortune to work with at the helm.
Turnover is horrific, complaints to HR have been common over my years here and nothing ever happens.
Leadership is cruel and a bullying culture is accepted. 
No room for development and training only possible if you can find a free course - good luck!
Staff are overworked and treated little better than animals - this is not the place to go if you want a work life balance or to see your children.
TOIL is seen as a waste of time rather than a basic right for staff.
Costs are cut haphazardly with little understanding of the impact - as long as it improves the bottom line in the short term, who cares?!

review_title: A wonderful period of time in my working career
pros:
I worked for Blind Veterans UK in 2017 and 2018 and it was one of the most enjoyable experiences I have had in my career.
The people I met and worked with were wonderful, the training was second to none and the Leadership in the form of support and guidance from the RBM's and Ops Directors was superb.
I have worked with many companies before, however Blind Veterans Uk was the most collaborative out of all of them.
We worked hard but we had fun doing so both with the members and our colleagues.
There were opportunities for career advancement and it was clear the Charity really care about their employees.
I still keep in touch with the Charity and as the title of this review says it really was "A wonderful period of time in my working career"
cons: None I can think of.

review_title: Exceptional Service Delivery - A lot of Change!
pros:
- Staff and volunteers are extremely passionate about their work; unlike any other charity I have worked for.
- Remuneration is very good for the sector.
- The workforce is engaged and skilled.
- The Trustees have set an ambitious strategy
cons: The pace of change was unreal.  A 5 year strategy was designed in a year, and it felt like implementation was being pushed in 5 minutes. It went from nothing one minute, to a complete regional transformation, job losses, job recruitments, building closures etc etc. It was absolutely manic.

review_title: Poor Management from the top down.
pros: The members of the charity are fantastic as is what the charity stands for.
cons: I wouldn't recommend the experience at all with the current management team. The managers rule with a bullying management culture and a HR team that protects them, not interested in the employee. Preferential treatment if your face fits. The more senior management are led by the chosen few and those that aren't in 'THE TEAM' are too afraid to speak out for fear of reprisal!
